dailyPriceChange.name: Sandisk Corporation
dailyPriceChange.news: SNDK stock surged 10.63% to $501.29 amid explosive gains driven by its position as a leading beneficiary of the AI-driven NAND flash memory supercycle, with surging demand from data centers, edge computing, and complex AI workloads. The rally follows Sandisk's spinoff from Western Digital in February 2025, which has seen shares rise over 800% in the past year, fueled by the ramp-up of its advanced BiCS8 technology node addressing AI scalability needs and upcoming high-bandwidth flash innovations. Analysts highlight persistent NAND shortages, pricing tailwinds, and Sandisk's growing market share in enterprise SSDs as key factors positioning it for outsized growth despite Wall Street's underestimation.

dailyPriceChange.name: Micron Technology, Inc.
dailyPriceChange.news: Micron Technology's stock surged after the company announced a $1.8 billion deal to acquire a chip fabrication site in Taiwan from Powerchip Semiconductor. This strategic acquisition is intended to boost the production of DRAM memory chips. The move addresses the skyrocketing demand and pricing for memory chips, which are critical components for artificial intelligence (AI) data centers.
